xiQ Overview
edit

What is xiQ?

xiQ’s Personality-driven Sales and Marketing Platform™ combines neuroscience, psychology, and AI to understand the buyers’ mindset and the factors that influence their purchasing decisions. Our award-winning, proprietary AI platform delivers personality insights, comprehensive account intelligence, and real-time, curated content right to your team’s fingertips so they can build trust and close deals faster. ​ Our large enterprise customers have engaged their audiences 10x better as compared to traditional marketing channels, saved thousands of hours of research time, and achieved up to 24% higher close win rates. ​ ​ Key capabilities of xiQ’s proprietary AI-powered platform: ​ * Personality-driven insights for one-to-one sales playbooks ​ * SmartSourced Content™ that drives 10x engagement​ * First-party intent data and advanced analytics to individualize every interaction​ * Instasites (microsites designed for individualized experiences) ​ * Comprehensive all-in-one company profiles compiled in seconds ​ * Sales triggers and real-time alerts direct to your inbox ​ * Outlook, Salesforce, MS Teams, and social media integration ​ ​ Experience xiQ at xiQinc.com.

"I start my day with XIQ"

What do you like best about xiQ?

One of the first thing I do in the start of my day is to have a look at the meetings I am having that day (and sometime the next few days). If I have new customer meetings, I will have a look at the XIQ data for company and the people that was included in the meeting.

Having the People Profile's is very handy when I need to interact or communicate with internal or external customer. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about xiQ?

The downside of XIQ is when I am unable to find information on People. In most cases, the people do not have an online profile (that I can find), so not exactly XIQ fault. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is xiQ solving and how is that benefiting you?

Working in a very diverse environment, the way you communicate with people is especially important for me. Understanding their behaviours, how to sell to the people, while building their trust… This is where XIQ is helping me solve my problems with my customers. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Feb 20, 2023

"xiQ: An Invaluable Sales Tool for Meeting Prep"

What do you like best about xiQ?

In a nutshell, learning as much about a prospect's DISC style prior to initial meetings allows for a customized approach to conversations, email communications, etc. It's a straightforwars application, as long as there's a current LinkedIn profile available for a prospect. If there isn't, providing as much background research on an individual as possible to the attentive and responsive xiQ staff results in a profile link, when one hasn't been available either through the Salesforce app, or through the xiQ website. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about xiQ?

One of the recurring frustrations is that there may be some incongruence between titles and/or company names within our Salesforce account contacts, so using xiQ through that app doesn't always produce a result. As long as we can find an individual on LinkedIn, though, we can search through the xiQ website. It isn't always an efficient process--i.e., it can result in wasted time when preparing for a meeting. Another frustration is when an individual's company name isn't used in their LinkedIn profile "header," it often isn't picked up during an xiQ search on the website if we use first name + last name + company name. if we get creative, and use first name + last name + "engineer," for example (if that's a keyword in the LinkedIn header), it seems to work. It's again a matter of extra time spent. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is xiQ solving and how is that benefiting you?

I wouldn't describe it as a problem-solving tool, so much as it's a sales enhancement tool. It allows us to learn as much about an individual's DISC style, prior to an initial meeting, as we can--without having to spend the time during the meeting looking for clues or "tells" of their style. It's a timesaver in that respect. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Sep 19, 2019

"Streamlines Content Curation and Improves Client Engagement"

What do you like best about xiQ?

The xiQ content curation portal has shaved hours or perhaps days off our search for quality articles that only meet our keyword criteria. Through refinement of our keywords with a simple click and update of words or phrases, the xiQ curated results have really hit the mark for us. Every week, we are able to produce a top-notch newsletter that our readers really are interested in and our click through rates are consistently improving with each digest we release. The ability to choose custom date ranges, sort by relevancy or dates, and customize articles by swapping out images and editing titles is also very useful to us. Our newsletters are frequently shared with others and new subscribers are added each week due to the high-quality content we are able to produce with minimal effort.

We are also excited to be working with xiQ to interface between our Salesforce portal so that we can better use the personas functionality and see analytics as to what articles or additional organic content our audience members are most interested in. We will be using xiQ for part of our drip marketing campaign efforts and we're excited to see how this helps with customer engagement.

I've even been working with the team to provide suggestions on the interface due to the way we use the portal compared to other companies (we focus on the last week's articles for our weekly newsletter whereas other companies may focus on articles generated over time). They have been extremely willing to listen to our input and have already implemented some of the suggestions, which is very rare these days that a company is willing to take an individual user's feedback and react so quickly. They truly care about our company's success and go the extra mile to listen to our needs. THANK YOU!

xiQ is a fabulous marketing tool for engaging with clients and prospects, and you'll love working with them! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about xiQ?

I was a bit intimidated by the tool at first and didn't want to "break" anything while curating content, but the xiQ team was quick to get on multiple calls with me to ensure nothing would be broken and showed me how content could be curated again if I changed my mind about deleting an article. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is xiQ solving and how is that benefiting you?

We were previously scouring the Internet for articles by using various search terms or saving articles we had read from one of the publications we're subscribed to for our industry. With xiQ, we can curate content within seconds based on the keywords we were previously searching for manually. Every time, there has been content produced that we would never have found through a manual search. This is saving time for us here at i2c and, ultimately money, and everyone knows "time is money." Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

"Extremely useful technology and great support team"

What do you like best about xiQ?

We have been using both the xiQ for Marketing (AI Newsletter Curation) and and xiQ for Sales (Dossier) solutions. The newsletter technology is incredibly useful for thought leadership and keeping up with new trends, and it makes it easy to generate content for our customers. The newsletter metrics are very detailed and useful as well. On the sales intelligence side, our Business Development team uses the Dossier solution to generate a personality analysis of every person they schedule a meeting with, plus a profile of the company.

The entire xiQ team has been wonderful with their prompt communication, speed and efficiency in addressing questions and concerns, and willingness to implement new features. In the 5 months we've had xiQ they have improved the platform so much based on our requested features. I'm very impressed with everyone I've interacted with at xiQ. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about xiQ?

At first some of the workflow in the Newsletter Workbench was a little confusing, but these were minor issues that were user error and/or fixed by the xiQ team later on. For example, switching between the Curate and Personalize tabs sometimes resets things if I don't go through the Saved versions. Also, I think the contact upload and management page could be improved. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is xiQ solving and how is that benefiting you?

The AI newsletter curation tool searches the internet with keywords, aggregates relevant articles, and makes it easy to drag and drop chosen articles into the newsletter. Once our company-specific template was created it was extremely easy and quick to generate a newsletter. This is faster than the old process of our email team having to manually search and pull news articles.

For the sales team, a common problem was that Account Executives wanted more information on the prospect or the company. Supplementing BDR notes with the xiQ personal and company profiles gives the sales team relevant information in a structured format, including a DISC personality analysis of the prospect and recommendations on how to speak to them. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
